sections.body: Frost giant raiders are the terror of the north, racing out of the snow to rend and slaughter for the sheer joy of battle and conquest.
sections.name: Frost Giant Raider
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Raider

sections.ac: 23, touch 8, flat-footed 23 (+5 armor, +1 deflection, +10 natural, -2 rage, -1 size)
sections.special_attacks: rage (13 rounds/day), rage powers (knockback), rock throwing (120 ft.)
sections.other_gear: +1 chain shirt, +1 greataxe, amulet of natural armor +1, belt of giant strength +2, cloak of resistance +1, ring of protection +1, 380 gp
sections.feats: Cleave, Dazzling Display, Great Cleave, Improved Bull Rush, Intimidating Prowess, Power Attack, Shatter Defenses, Weapon Focus (greataxe)

sections.body:
During Combat The raider begins combat with Dazzling Display, then uses Shatter Defenses to keep her intimidated targets on the defensive.

Base Statistics When she's not raging, the barbarian's statistics are

AC 25, touch 10, flat-footed 25

hp 195

Fort +20

Will +8; +1 greataxe +25/+20/+15 (3d6+19/×3); rock +11 (1d8+18)

Str 35

Con 24

CMB +25

CMD 36

Skills Climb +18, Intimidate +30.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: Raiders are the shock troops of frost giant tribes, usually consisting of the tribe's toughest, most intimidating warriors. On raids, they exult in the fear that their mighty appearance causes, often breaking enemy lines with the sheer sight of their howling charge. Unlike frost giant rangers, frost giant raiders are less concerned with stealth or tactics than with impressing each other via dramatic feats, and wiser jarls know when to rein in their troops lest frost giant bravado and a desire for bragging rights lose them a battle—or, more often, result in unnecessary destruction of valuable slaves and plunder.

While larger tribes are usually ruled by a jarl or another powerful figure, in smaller tribes a raider might serve as a leader. Some raiders could even be chieftains who pledge fealty to a mighty jarl's larger clan. Since a frost giant tribe ruled by a mere raider is likely to be easy pickings for a more fearsome tribe looking to increase its holdings, raider-led tribes often find it safer to move out of their traditional homelands and into softer country, and thus they often come into conflict with smaller humanoids.

sections.name: Frost Giant Raider
sections.skills: Climb +20, Intimidate +32, Perception +22, Stealth -5 (-1 in snow)
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Raider/Frost Giant Raider
sections.combat_gear: potions of cure serious wounds (2), potion of displacement, potion of protection from arrows, potion of protection from energy (fire), alchemist's fire (5)

sections.body: Frost giant rangers hunt big game to feed their tribes, and take point on raids.

sections.body: Frost giant sorcerers excel in harnessing the power of the elements and bolstering raiders in combat.
sections.name: Frost Giant Ice Mage
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Ice Mage

sections.ac: 26, touch 10, flat-footed 26 (+2 armor, +1 deflection, +10 natural, +4 shield, -1 size)
sections.melee: mwk morningstar +21/+16/+11 (2d6+12) or 2 slams +20 (1d8+8 plus 1d6 cold)
sections.other_gear: mwk morningstar, amulet of natural armor +1, bracers of armor +2, ring of protection +1, 362 gp

spells.bloodline spell-like abilities:
(CL 6th; concentration +9)

7/day-cold steel (grant weapon or 50 ammunition frost weapon special ability for 3 rounds)

spells.sorcerer spells known:
(CL 6th; concentration +9)

3rd (4/day)-dispel magic

2nd (6/day)-frigid touch, ice slick, rage (DC 16)

1st (7/day)-enlarge person, expeditious retreat, obscuring mist, shield, true strike

0 (at will)-detect magic, ghost sound (DC 13), flare (DC 13), mage hand, message, ray of frost, touch of fatigue (DC 13)

Bloodline boreal

sections.feats: Arcane Strike, Born of Frost*, Chilled Rock*, Combat Casting, Eschew Materials, Extend Spell, Improved Initiative, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Skill Focus (Stealth)

sections.body:
Before Combat A frost giant ice mage casts shield and expeditious retreat .

During Combat A frost giant ice mage uses his wand of solid fog to trap opponents, then blasts them at range with his wand of ice storm or wand of lightning bolt . He casts ice slick and uses his icewalker bloodline ability to outmaneuver his opponents in icy and snowy areas.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: Ice mages inherit the magic of the icy north. While some are tricksters and manipulators—perhaps using enlarge person to grow to Huge size and trick travelers into thinking they're cloud giants—many act as support and artillery for their tribe's raiders, killing at a distance with the power of a storm or increasing their allies' size and ferocity. As powerful as sorcerers may be, frost giant society still places more value in physical strength and melee prowess, meaning sorcerers are usually advisors rather than leaders.

sections.name: Frost Giant Ice Mage
sections.skills: Bluff +12, Climb +21, Craft (alchemy) +15, Intimidate +16, Knowledge (arcana) +15, Perception +25, Spellcraft +15, Stealth +12 (+16 in snow)
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Ice Mage/Frost Giant Ice Mage
sections.combat_gear: potions of cure serious wounds (2), potion of invisibility, potion of protection from energy (fire), wand of ice storm (10 charges), wand of lightning bolt (10 charges), wand of solid fog (5 charges), alchemist's fire (4)

sections.body: Frost giant priests are as scheming as they are violent, controlling others through fear and tradition.
sections.name: Frost Giant Battle Priest
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Battle Priest

sections.special_attacks: channel negative energy 5/day (DC 16, 4d6), might of the gods (+8, 8 rounds/day), rock throwing (120 ft.), weapon master (8 rounds/day)

spells.cleric spells prepared:
(CL 8th; concentration +14)

4th-blessing of fervor, communal protection from energy, divine power D, unholy blight (DC 20)

3rd-enter image, invisibility purge, magic vestment D, protection from energy, sacred bon d

2nd-align weapon, death knell (DC 18), hold person (DC 18), magic boulder *, spiritual weapon D, weapon of awe

1st-bane (DC 17), bless, command (DC 17), cure light wounds, divine favor, enlarge person D (DC 17), shield of faith

0 (at will)-detect magic, guidance, mending, read magic

D domain spell; Domains Strength, War

sections.feats: Brew Potion, Cleave, Combat Casting, Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Craft Wand, Great Cleave, Improved Sunder, Lightning Reflexes, Martial Weapon Proficiency (battleaxe), Power Attack, Vital Strike

sections.body:
Before Combat A battle priest casts bull's strength, magic vestment, and protection from energy (fire) before combat, and sacred bond if her jarl is present.

During Combat The battle priest opens combat by casting divine power, then uses spells like blessing of fervor to support allies and unholy blight to harm opponents.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: A frost giant battle priest uses her powers seeking out those who would undercut her authority or that of the chief, through spying on, manipulating, and threatening the rest of the tribe. When needed, she's not averse to taking up her battleaxe and splitting a few heads.

sections.name: Frost Giant Battle Priest
sections.skills: Climb +17, Craft (armor) +10, Intimidate +15, Knowledge (religion) +14, Perception +30, Spellcraft +7, Stealth +1 (+5 in snow)
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Battle Priest/Frost Giant Battle Priest
sections.combat_gear: potions of bull's strength (2), potions of cure serious wounds (4), potions of protection from energy (2), potion of water breathing, wand of cure critical wounds (15 charges), wand of cure moderate wounds (15 charges)

sections.body: Frost giants often use subjugated predators like wolves to help them chase down their quarry.
sections.name: Frost Giant Houndmaster
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Houndmaster

sections.ac: 28, touch 10, flat-footed 28 (+7 armor, +1 deflection, +11 natural, -1 size)
sections.special_attacks: rock throwing (120 ft.), snowcaster, wild shape 3/day
sections.other_gear: +3 hide armor, +1 greataxe, amulet of natural armor +1, belt of mighty constitution +2, cloak of resistance +1, headband of inspired wisdom +2, manacles of cooperation (2), ring of protection +1, 1,465 gp

spells.druid spells prepared:
(CL 10th; concentration +16)

5th-animal growth (DC 21), cure critical wounds, transmute rock to mud (DC 21)

4th-cure serious wounds, flame strike (DC 21), ice storm, spike stones (DC 20)

3rd-call lightning (DC 20), dominate animal (DC 19), protection from energy, sleet storm

2nd-animal trance (DC 18), barkskin, bull's strength, chill metal, delay poison, hold animal (DC 18)

1st-charm animal (DC 17), entangle (DC 17), frostbite, obscuring mist, speak with animals (2)

0 (at will)-create water, detect magic, light, purify food and drink

sections.feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Natural Armor, Intimidating Prowess, Lightning Reflexes, Martial Weapon Proficiency (greataxe), Natural Spell, Power Attack, Scribe Scroll, Spell Focus (evocation), Toughness, Weapon Focus (greataxe)

sections.body:
Before Combat The houndmaster casts protection from energy (fire) on herself, casts animal growth, barkskin, and bull's strength on her animal companion, and then casts call lightning .

During Combat The houndmaster fights with axe and magic together, directing lightning bolts from call lightning and miring opponents with entangle, sleet storm, and transmute rock to mud .
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: A houndmaster is responsible for the care of the tribe's pets, frequently polar bears, wolves, and winter wolves. She is fond of pitting her charges against each other, allowing the packs to establish a functional hierarchy and ensuring that only the strongest survive to breed. Some houndmasters choose these pack leaders as animal companions.

sections.special_qualities: arctic native, icewalking, nature bond (animal companion), nature sense, wild empathy +12
sections.name: Frost Giant Houndmaster
sections.skills: Bluff +9, Handle Animal +20, Heal +14, Intimidate +29, Knowledge (geography) +9 (+14 in cold or icy terrain), Knowledge (nature) +16, Perception +29 (+34 in cold or icy terrain), Stealth -6 (+3 in cold or icy terrain), Survival +21 (+26 in cold or icy terrain), Swim +15
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Houndmaster/Frost Giant Houndmaster
sections.combat_gear: pearl of power (2nd), scrolls of cure serious wounds (2), antitoxin (2)

sections.body: Brutal lords of the frost giant tribes, jarls brook no argument from those beneath them.
sections.name: Frost Giant Jarl
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Jarl

sections.ac: 35, touch 15, flat-footed 31 (+9 armor, +2 deflection, +4 Dex, +11 natural, -1 size)
sections.special_attacks: combat style (two-weapon), favored enemy (giants +2, humans +4), rock throwing (120 ft.)
sections.racial_modifiers: +4 Acrobatics when jumping, +4 Stealth in snow
sections.other_gear: +4 chain shirt, +1 warhammer (2), amulet of natural armor +2, belt of physical might +4 (Dex, Con), boots of the winterlands, cloak of resistance +3, ring of protection +2, stone of alarm, 1,886 gp

spells.ranger spells prepared:
(CL 6th; concentration +7)

2nd-communal returning weapon

1st-call animal, charm animal (DC 12), lead blades

sections.feats: Double Slice, Dreadful Carnage, Endurance, Furious Focus, Greater Two-Weapon Fighting, Improved Iron Will, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Iron Will, Point-Blank Shot, Power Attack, Precise Shot, Toughness, Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Rend, Weapon Focus (warhammer)

sections.body:
Before Combat The jarl casts communal returning weapon on his warhammers.

During Combat The jarl makes full attacks with his warhammers against targets at any range.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: Jarls rule their tribes and subordinates with an iron fist—or a hammer to the skull. Jarls take and hold their positions through force. While many might wish to see their stations pass on to their progeny, heredity carries little weight in frost giant society, and jarls understand that their children can assume power only by violently seizing it. As a result, frost giant jarls are hard on their children, encouraging sibling rivalries in hopes that one child will eventually prove strong enough to rule.

sections.special_qualities: favored terrain (cold +4, forest +2), hunter's bond (companions), swift tracker, track +4, wild empathy +9, woodland stride
sections.name: Frost Giant Jarl
sections.skills: Acrobatics +8 (+12 when jumping), Climb +23, Diplomacy +5, Heal +9, Intimidate +23, Perception +24, Perform (sing) +5, Sense Motive +11, Stealth +17 (+21 in snow), Survival +14
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Frost Giants/Example Frost Giants/Frost Giant Jarl/Frost Giant Jarl
sections.combat_gear: potions of cure serious wounds (3), potion of protection from energy (fire), alchemist's fire (2)
